title: Niall Horan's tattoo blunder leaves Roman Kemp with permanent typo as stunt goes wrong

Niall Horan has left radio presenter Roman Kemp with an unsightly tattoo after a charity stunt went horribly wrong.

The former One Direction star was tasked with tattooing the name of his new single onto the Capital Breakfast’s presenter's leg for charity - but he misspelled it.

Niall, 26, offered to make a £5,000 donation to Global’s Make Some Noise charity if Roman allowed him to ink the words Nice To Meet Ya.

However, the singer, who had never used a tattoo gun before, got it wrong and inked Nice to Melt Ya instead.

Niall followed in the footsteps of Ed Sheeran , who previously tattooed "Ed Woz Ere 2k7" on Roman back in 2017.

The Irish pop star said: "I don’t know how they do this on a regular basis, this is scary!"

(Image: YouTube)

(Image: YouTube)

Roman jokingly asked what was scary, to which Niall replied: "The fact that it’s on your skin until he day you die and probably for about 15 years after while you rot!"

As Niall completed Roman's fresh new artwork, the shocked presenter quickly noticed the permanent spelling mistake.

He said: "Oh my God! You’ve written ‘Nice to Melt Ya!’ on my leg! You’re calling my mum!"

The stunt was held to raise funds for No Money Road trip across the UK, with all proceeds going to Global's charity.

Next week, Roman will embark on the 1,000-mile journey, hosting five shows in five different locations.

The catch is that he has to complete the epic cycling trip without the use of his phone or any money.

(Image: YouTube)

(Image: YouTube)

Starting on Monday, Roman will travel from Scotland to Wales and then eventually back to London in time for Global’s Make Some Noise Day on Friday.

Roman's route is set to be decided by his fellow Capital presenters and celebrity friends.

He’ll have to complete challenges and he’ll be calling on listeners as he attempts to make it to his next radio show in time.

(Image: YouTube)

Roman's charity challenge comes as the DJ is reportedly set to star in the 2019 series of I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!

The airwaves host, who is the son of Spandau Ballet's Martin Kemp and Wham! star Shirley and the godson of the late George Michael, has told his employers that he is using his annual leave to appear on I'm A Celebrity.

According to The Sun , Roman's celebrity connections is what is thought to have made him an attractive camp mate to ITV bosses.
